column4: Hey i'm installing Call of Duty Modern Warfare 2 on Wine using PlayOnLinux and I need to force Gmount to unmount cdrom1 for me and then mount the second disk in it's place
people on the internet say to put in wine eject but that does not work
can anyone help me?
I need to force an unmount of a looped drive
mounted using gmount
how can I force gmount to unmount
sudo unmount --force what?
sudo mkdir /mnt/disk
ok I just tried and it says it's bussy
is there a nautilus open to /media/cdrom?
I've done this before
it's the installer that's keeping it locked
then pkill or kill the installer
NO!!!
the installer has to stay open
so I can mount the second disk
now someone understands
so how do you force a disk to unmount while it's bussy
stick a pin in the tiny hole on the front of the disk drive lol
it's mounted using gmount iso
I'm using an iso
no.. i kinda jumped into the problem halfway... but even as an iso... if the installer won't let go of the device, good luck..
